# Task

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example



# Data

wrap_string("This function will wrap words into lines")

Here is the solution:

```julia
function wrap_string(s; text_width::Int=10)
    words = split(s, " ")
    lines = String[]
    current_line = ""

    for word in words
        if length(current_line) + length(word) + 1 > text_width
            push!(lines, current_line)
            current_line = word
        else
            if !isempty(current_line)
                current_line *= " "
            end
            current_line *= word
        end
    end

    push!(lines, current_line)
    return join(lines, "\n")
end

# Example usage:
println(wrap_string("This function will wrap words into lines"))
```

This function splits the input string into words, then iterates over each word. If adding the current word to the current line would exceed the `text_width`, it starts a new line. Finally, it joins all lines with newline characters and returns the result.
